item.title: Chris add a quote by William Kennedy
item.description: "Let us, then, be up and doing, with a heart for any fate." -- William Kennedy

item.title: Chris add a quote by John Philpot Curran
item.description: "The price of freedom is eternal vigilance." -- John Philpot Curran

item.title: Chris add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Chris add a quote by Tom Hodgkinson
item.description: "If Adam and Eve were not hunter-gatherers, then they were certainly gatherers. But, then, consumer desire, or self-embitterment, or the 'itch,' as Schopenhauer called it, appeared in the shape of the serpent. This capitalistic monster awakens in Adam and Eve the possibility that things could be better. Instantly, they are cast out of the garden and condemned to a life of toil, drudgery, and pain. Wants supplanted needs, and things have been going downhill ever since. " -- Tom Hodgkinson

item.title: Chris add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chris add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man has imagined a heaven, and has left entirely out of it the supremest of all his delights...sexual intercourse!...His heaven is like himself: strange, interesting, astonishing, grotesque. I give you my word, it has not a single feature in it that he actually values." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Chris add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "When politics and home life have become one and the same thing, [...] then,[...] it is evident that we will be in a state of total liberty or anarchy." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Chris add a quote by A. N. Whitehead
item.description: "This loss [of freedom] means the fading from human life of values infinitely precious to it. The divergent use of individual temperaments can no longer find their various satisfactions in serious activities. There only remain ironbound conditions of employment and trivial amusements for leisure. " -- A. N. Whitehead
